verse.roman:
brāhmaṇāṁs tu mahā-bhāgān
kṛta-svastyayanā vayam
go-bhū-hiraṇya-vāsobhir
gajāśva-ratha-veśmabhiḥ

synonyms: brāhmaṇān—the brāhmaṇas; tu—and; mahā-bhāgān—greatly fortunate; kṛta—having performed; svasti-ayanāḥ—the ceremonies for good fortune; vayam—we; go—with cows; bhū—land; hiraṇya—gold; vāsobhiḥ—and clothing; gaja—with elephants; aśva—horses; ratha—chariots; veśmabhiḥ—and houses.
translation: After performing the expiatory rituals with the help of greatly fortunate brāhmaṇas, we will worship those brāhmaṇas by offering them cows, land, gold, clothing, elephants, horses, chariots and dwelling places.
